key_title: Key to the species of Coprosma

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rubiaceae

source.author: Thompson, I.R.
source.title: A revision of Asperula and Galium (Rubieae: Rubiaceae) in Australia
source.citation: From: Thompson, I.R. (2009). A revision of Asperula and Galium (Rubieae: Rubiaceae) in Australia. Muelleria 27:36-112.

leads.lead_text: Plant prostrate, matted or trailing; leaves usually less than 10 mm long, 1-nerved; flowers solitary, terminating short branchlets; plants usually alpine
Plant erect, mostly more than 1 m high; leaves usually more than 10 mm long, often reticulate-veined; flowers solitary in axils or in axillary clusters
Flowers bisexual or unisexual; leaves mostly 3–5 mm long; stipular sheath entire; fruit bluish (or possibly reddish-purple)
Flowers unisexual; leaves mostly 5–10 mm long; stipular sheath ciliate; fruit orange or red
Flowers bisexual; leaves sharply acute; plant entirely glabrous
Flowers unisexual; leaves acute or obtuse; plant with at least some crisped hairs on young leaves
Style branches 2; leaves linear-oblong; stems not or seldom rooting at nodes
Style branches 3 or 4; leaves broadly ovate-elliptic; stems rooting freely at nodes
Flowers solitary in axils; fruit bright red; branchlets often spiny; leaves mostly less than 5 mm wide
Flowers 3-many in axillary clusters; fruit orange-red; branchlets never spiny; leaves more than 10 mm wide
Leaves linear to narrow-ovate, thick-textured, glossy, 1-veined on lower surface
Leaves lanceolate to broad-ovate, thin-textured, dull, conspicuously reticulate veined on lower surface
Leaves usually 5–10 cm long, smooth, glabrous, acute or obtuse at apex; corolla-lobes shorter than tube; stipules never ciliate; introduced tall shrubs or small trees often more than 2 m high
Leaves usually less than 5 cm long, often scabrous, acuminate at apex; corolla-lobes longer than tube; stipules often ciliate-denticulate; widespread native to 2 m high
Fruit more or less globose, 6–8 mm diam.; leaves very lustrous on upper surface, with conspicuous domatia below, margins recurved, apex rounded, truncate or retuse
Fruit more or less ovoid, 4–5 mm wide; leaves not or only barely lustrous on upper surface, without domatia below, margins more or less flat, apex acute
